channel.title: [Contest] Auxy Summer Tournament 2K19 - Winners announced
channel.description:
Hi, everybody! ;P DHO back in the house and just in time for another Auxy Tournament! This time with co-hosts, @stereofield and @BobTheGUYYYYY.
Sign ups are now closed.
How it Works - So, as stated in the previous tournament: Players 1-4 are in the tournament. Player 1 ends up against Player 2, and 3 against 4. If Player 1 beats 2, and Player 4 beats 3, then the two winners (1 and 4) will compete.
In this instance, however, there are 32 players.
Judging - You will be judged out of ten points in the following categories:
Creativity - How unique is the song compared to other Auxy tracks? It's good to have a balance. Sure you can randomly place notes and make automation, and, although it may be different, it's not necessarily pleasing to listen to.
Composition - How good is the actual composition, when you take out all the automation etc.?
Accuracy: How much you stuck to the challenge's rules.
Execution: How well did you execute all the ideas you tried to pull off? How is the instrument choice? Mixing?
Challenges - After running several season based tournaments, I feel we've exhausted our season themed challenges. This time around, challenges will specifically test your skills in each area of producing.
**A few rules: If you wish to use any samples, please check with judges first. Individual hits are generally okay but please no sampled phrases. Work should be predominately completed in Auxy. Additionally, this time around there will be no extensions for late entries. The deadlines will not be extended and you will be disqualified if you do not meet the deadline.**
Prizes - The two finalists will get a :unicorn: to display next to your username. There will also be a repost for the winning track given by the Auxy Collective.
Always next time - Running tournaments is sort of a hobby of mine, so if you can't enter this time around, it's not too late. There will be a seventh Auxy Tournament. ___________
https://challonge.com/auxy
Good luck all! We will post the first challenge as soon as soon as we can after the tournament fills up. __________________

item.title: [Contest] Auxy Summer Tournament 2K19 - Winners announced
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
Alright, all. Itâ€™s been a huge journey, and my sincerest congratulations to every single person who entered the tournament and had the resolve to push themselves to adapt to challenges and put out some killer tracks!

But sadly, there can only be one winner, and after much thought, that trophy is going toâ€¦

@TC64!

Congratulations on winning your second Auxy Tournament! If you win another one may have to ban you from future tournaments, lol.

@HYDRANS, your track was awesome as well, and your work throughout the tournament was deeply impressive. Showed me a really unique side to Auxy.

Iâ€™d like to take time to thank my co-host, @stereofield, who ran the challonge page and helped getting this tournament started. Iâ€™d also like to thank co-host @BobTheGUYYYYY.

Thanks also to @Andrew_Adams for his help throughout the tournaments. He was too busy to join us this time around, but a big thanks nonetheless!

Lastly, thanks to all of you for coming along for the journey. See you all this winter for the next tournament.

Thanks,
DHO

Read full topic

item.title: [Contest] Auxy Summer Tournament 2K19 - Winners announced
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
Wow! I was blown away with your entries, guys. Sadly only two can come to the final, but whoever you are and when ever you left us in the tournament, I congratulate all of you for your commitment and all the fantastic entries you provided us with this time around.

The Challenge

All right, looking back on our summer memories, what are some things we have learned? Have you learned anything new about music or about yourself this summer? What kind of experiences have shaped your summer this year? Look back on a specific memory from this summer and write a track inspired by it. Let us know what the memory is.

The submissions are due by Wednesday, August 21st, 5:00 PM Pacific Time. Post a SoundCloud link here. We will not accept private messages/private links.

The Competitors:

@HYDRANS vs @TC64

Read full topic
